title: God's Call to Obedience
shortSummary: Psalm 81 is a call to worship and obedience, reminding Israel of God's deliverance and provision. It highlights God's desire for His people to listen to His voice, avoid idolatry, and walk in His ways to receive His blessings and protection.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to Asaph, reflecting on Israel's history from the Exodus

keyCharacters.name: Asaph
keyCharacters.description: The Psalmist and chief musician who leads Israel in worship and recounts God's faithfulness.

keyCharacters.name: Israel
keyCharacters.description: God's chosen people, called to remember His deliverance and obey His statutes.

keyCharacters.name: Joseph
keyCharacters.description: Representing the tribe or region where God established a testimony, recalling the Exodus from Egypt.

definitions.definition: A type of musical instrument or style of music associated with Gath, used in worship.
A hand drum or tambourine used in ancient Israelite worship to accompany singing.
The place where Israel tested God by complaining for water during their wilderness journey.
Any deity other than the LORD, forbidden for Israel to worship.

outline.heading: Call to Worship and Musical Praise
outline.description: The Psalm opens with a joyful call to sing and make music to God using various instruments during the appointed feasts, emphasizing worship as a communal and celebratory act.

outline.heading: Remembering God's Deliverance
outline.description: God recalls His saving acts during the Exodus, freeing Israel from Egyptian bondage and answering their cries in times of trouble, establishing His faithfulness.

outline.heading: God's Call to Obedience
outline.description: God invites Israel to listen and obey, warning against idolatry and promising provision and blessing if they open their hearts to Him.

outline.heading: Israel's Rebellion and Consequences
outline.description: Despite God's call, Israel refuses to listen and follows their own desires, resulting in God allowing them to face the consequences of their disobedience.

outline.heading: The Blessings of Obedience
outline.description: God expresses His desire to bless Israel abundantly, subdue their enemies, and satisfy them with the finest provisions if they would only walk in His ways.

application: Regularly engage in heartfelt worship, using music and praise to honor God and remember His faithfulness.
Listen attentively to God's voice through Scripture and prayer, obeying His commands to avoid spiritual pitfalls like idolatry.
Trust in God's provision and protection by walking in His ways, even when facing challenges or opposition.
Repent promptly when you recognize disobedience, knowing God desires to restore and bless His people.

keyVerses.text: I am the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's identity as Deliverer and His promise to provide abundantly for those who trust and obey Him.

keyVerses.text: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
keyVerses.significance: It reveals the tragic reality of Israel's rejection of God's guidance, serving as a solemn warning against spiritual stubbornness.

keyVerses.text: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
keyVerses.significance: Expresses God's heartfelt desire for His people to obey, underscoring the blessings tied to faithful living.
